page.title: 15TAILS OF OLD ASHBY
page.content:
On waste ground by the Shoulder of Mutton at the turn of the century was a tent which housed the first{MOVING {PICTURE SHOW}in Great Britain.Owned by Mr Arther Twigden,it comprised a cinematagraph of still pictures flipped over at speed giving the illusion of moving pictures.The cinamatagraph was in turn linked to a gramophone which played in unison with the pictures.The whole thing was driven by a steam_engine.
During the '14_'18 war a shop next to Rushdens,owned by Mr Tyler was turned into a soup kitchen.Mr Tyler's monkey was a great attraction.One day the soup was extra_special and declared delicious,but the monkey had gone,not to be seen again.To this day anything missing for no apparent reason is_another"Tyler's Monkey".
